channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3084] WolframAlpha is Brutally Honest (PIC)
[+1713] Oil reaches Louisiana shores (PICS)
item.description: Over one month after the initial explosion and sinking of the Deepwater Horizon oil rig, crude oil continues to flow into the Gulf of Mexico, and oil slicks have slowly reached as far as 12 miles into Louisiana's marshes. According to Louisiana Governor Bobby Jindal, more than 65 miles of Louisiana's shoreline has now been oiled.

item.title: [+1680] Jesse Ventura: "Something Is Wrong With America" [video]
item.description: "This country will impeach a President for cheating on his wife, but we wonâ€™t impeach a President for lying to us and taking us to war where thousands are killed. Something is wrong with that."

item.title: [+1539] Google Pac-Man Mightve Cost Us $120,483,800
item.description: Last week, the Google logo was turned into a game of Pac-Man and we all took breaks to play. In theory, we wasted a combined 4,819,352 hours and many, many dollars. Here's the math.

item.title: [+1317] Yahoo! CEO Tells Michael Arrington to "F*ck Off" (Video)
item.description: Michael Arrington is almost as famous for founding TechCrunch as he is for irritating people. During an interview at today's TechCrunch Disrupt event, he set off Yahoo! CEO, Carol Bartz by insinuating she was leading the company astray by not focusing on search.

item.title: [+1284] British Women Have The World's Best Curves
item.description: Researchers have discovered that women in Britain have the most shapely bodies on the planet. A recent global survey of breasts discovered the average British woman wears a size 34D bra -- meaning she has bigger boobs and is more slender than most around the world.

item.title: [+1274] I proposed to my girl with this mineral, not a diamond
[+1221] These aren't the nuts you're looking for
[+1145] Cops' 400 Pot Plants Turn Out to Be Horsemint (Awkward)
item.description: Cops in Corpus Christi, who are clearly very well-intentioned but maybe not the sharpest tools in the police shed, seized some 400 marijuana plants from a city park. Only, they were not marijuana, so much as, 'horsemint"

item.title: [+1127] Best News Lead Ever? Best News Lead Ever.
item.description: Not even going to bother trying not to spoil it. Just read.

item.title: [+952] Anyone excited about this? (pic)
[+704] If T-Shirts Told the Truth [CHART]
item.description: Common, cheap, easy to wear item of clothing doubles as a dangerous karmic loophole for people who want to share their misguided views with the world, but lack the courage to get a tattoo.

item.title: [+695] Mystery of the Constantly-Draining Hot Tub Solved
item.description: Staff at the Etali Safari Lodge in South Africa were baffled by the mystery of the disappearing bath water. Now the answer has been found - and her name is Troublesome.

item.title: [+694] Marine Brags on Facebook About Humiliating Afghani (PIC)
item.description: Digg won't let us tell you what Lionel Garcia posted on his Facebook wall. So you're just going to have to click through.

item.title: [+684] Speed Tests Show Flash 10.1 Slowing Down Android 2.2
item.description: Here's the bottom line on the first speed tests of Android 2.2: without Flash 10.1, its browser handily beats all comers. But with Flash? It drops to the bottom of the heap. Ruh roh.

item.title: [+656] Wal-Mart Cuts iPhone Price To $97
item.description: Wal-Mart, the world's largest retailer, plans to slash the price of Apple's 16GB 3GS iPhone to $97 beginning Tuesday. Apple is widely expected to unveil a brand-new iPhone next month, and could be working with retailers to clear out its remaining inventory of the about-to-be-outdated model.

item.title: [+619] Seagate's New Hybrid Drive -- SSD Performance at HDD Price
item.description: Seagate announced its latest attempt to jump start sales in the niche SSD hybrid drive market today with the Momentus XT, a 7200 RPM hard-disk drive combined with 3GB of solid-state drive capacity at a starting price point of $113.

item.title: [+592] Reporter Can't Break Glass With Hammer [vid]
item.description: A life of crime is definitely not in his future.

item.title: [+591] Tallest Man in U.S. Announced (Pic)
item.description: Igor Vovkovinskiy beat out the previous record-holder, Virginia deputy sheriff George Bell, by a third of an inch, according to Guinness.

item.title: [+571] The 10 Best Moments of The Lost Finale And The Five Worst
item.description: There were things to love and things to be annoyed by, just as in pretty much every other episode of Lost-- but overall there was way more good than bad. This is a list of the 10 best things (Vincent!) about the Lost finale and a few things which didn't work (Richard?).
